p: Poultry movement from the broiler-trading platform in Anhui was disturbed when H7N9 influenza emerged in March 2013. Before then, these broilers mainly went to Shanghai, Hubei, Hunan and Guangdong provinces. In April 2013, the volume of yellow broilers sent to eastern parts of China (especially big cities like Shanghai and Hangzhou city) decreased and movements to more northerly provinces (mainly to Shandong, Hebei and Henan provinces) increased ( S2 Table). The number of transport destinations also increased from 44 destination counties in March to 69 destination counties in April. In May 2013, most of the yellow broilers were sent to Shandong province and almost no yellow broilers were sold to south and eastern China and trade volume dropped sharply ( Fig 2).
